title: Chairs For Sitting On Stairs
description: ARTA Architects has designed the Tai Kwun Chairs for The Hong Kong Jockey Club, allowing a more comfortable and modular seating solution for these stairs. The chairs complement the distinctive design languages of the Tai Kwun arts and cultural centre’s ancient and contemporary architecture. Each chair’s elegant curving form is ergonomically designed for comfort and […]
author: Erin

title: This Modern Home Was Designed Around A Split-Trunk Oak Tree
description: A Parallel Architecture has shared photos of a modern home they completed in Austin, Texas, that’s designed around a split-trunk live oak, which has stood guard over the center of the tight lot for decades. The home’s exterior features concrete, wood, and large windows, with some parts of the house extending out over the ground […]
author: Erin

title: Salem Public Library Renovation / Hacker Architects
description: The Salem Public Library's downtown location was due for a renovation to bring its structural resilience and building systems up to modern standards. The 96,000-square-foot concrete structure was built in 1970 and underwent an expansion in 1990. When funding came through for seismic renovation, accessibility improvements and life-safety updates, the city and library saw a rare chance to address some of the additional challenges encountered by staff and library patrons in their aging concrete building and outdated spaces.
author: Pilar Caballero

title: Donavan House / PIMAA
description: Nestled between the serenity of a pine forest, this project captures the essence of Comporta’s landscape. Inspired by the sun, the fishermen’s traditions, and the raw beauty of the region, the design reinterprets the humble fishermen’s wooden huts of the local dock of Carrascaleira. The result? A contemporary sanctuary where architecture exists in quiet harmony with its surroundings.
author: Valeria Silva

title: Designs released of Frida Escobedo's limestone-clad wing for The Met
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art and Mexican architect Frida Escobedo have released designs of a limestone-clad expansion to the Tang Wing, the first wing designed by a woman in the museum's 154-year history. title: Dezeen Debate features "brutal but wavuncular" water tower
description: The latest edition of our Dezeen Debate newsletter features a sculptural water tower by White Arkitekter. Subscribe to Dezeen Debate now. Swedish firm White Arkitekter completed the wave-shaped concrete reservoir in Varberg, Sweden, elevated on nine columns. The tower was constructed to address the growing water demand in the municipality.
